answers.answer: Just for good measure, my lab values:TSH - 3.01T4 Free non-dialysis - 1.1T3 Free non-dialysis - 2.7
Hi.  No one has an answer for me yet?  I'm a little worried.
Hey, have you been tested for diabetes or lupus? How about any other autoimmune diseases?

Thanks for response!  My blood glucose is in the normal range, both fasting, and not fasting.  I think it was 89 fasting and 95 non-fasting.  ANA was negative.  What other tests would be done?I haven't been tested for any other autoimmune diseases - I don't know what others to ask about.  That's why I thought Hashimoto's though.  My lymphocytes and eosiniphils % were high and my basophil numbers were low.  Its seems like that is pretty par for people with autoimmune diseases.

At the close TSH range you are at in the very high end of normal I think you may be experiencing thyroid (A-symptomatic) symptoms - but other issues could be going on.Your adrenals - which control the thyroid hormones in your system could be depleted and that is why your labs are so close to normal.To eliminate Adrenal Fatigue you need a cortisol blood or better yet 24 hr saliva test. Also a ACTH test (which is blood work too)  You may need to get on Vit C - magnesium and cortisol to correct this - but labs need to be done.If your adrenals are weakening - this would cause your many symptoms you are having.

question: I've been having symptoms of hypothyroidism, but I'm not sure what is wrong.  I just had blood work done, and have a feeling evreything is goingt o come back normal (as usual) and I will get a pat on the head and sent away.  Let me get this straight, I DON'T want anything to be wrong with me, but I have very real symptoms that I don't understand.Symptoms: extreme fatigue (I feel like I can't make it through the day) - its not like just being tired, its weakness.  I also have experienced lack of concentration, dizziness, floaties in my eyes, swelling of my feet and ankles, lots of abdominal bloating and pain, and of course, weight gain.  I gained 5-7 lbs in two weeks, then lost it all in 2 days (edema).   A lot of the time, I can't exercise to my full potential and get tired and really dizzy and "lower" heart rates.  I also feel like I can't get enough air in my lungs when I work out (but I have asthma, so I've always attributed it to that).  Sometimes I feel like my heart is racing, but I'm not sure it is.  My pulse always seems to be normal when its taken.  My blood pressure is always normal.I have a history of psoriasis.  I am recovering from a guttate outbreak from August.  I have some joint pain, but i haven't been formally diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis.  The edema is really what freaked me out - that just started.  My feet got a little swollen and hurt a bit, but I tried to pass it off as sitting a lot, possibly psoriatic arthritis, etc.  Well, when I gained the 5-7 lbs and my ankle bones went missing, I got a little scared.  I have considered congestive heart failure too, but I don't know.  I'm 27 years old.   I guess i"m just asking for some opinions.  Thanks.
title: Not sure what's wrong
